channel.description: Recent content in Guide on mungOps manual (dev)

item.title: Organize Files
item.description:
Directory Structure

By default, Hugo searches for Markdown files in the content directory, and the structure of the directory determines the final output structure of your website. Take this site as an example:

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Hugo reads its configuration from hugo.yaml in the root of your Hugo site. The config file is where you can configure all aspects of your site. Check out the config file for this site exampleSite/hugo.yaml on GitHub to get a comprehensive idea of available settings and best practices.

item.title: Markdown
item.description: Hugo supports Markdown syntax for formatting text, creating lists, and more. This page will show you some of the most common Markdown syntax examples.

item.title: Syntax Highlighting
item.description: Hugo uses Chroma, a general purpose syntax highlighter in pure Go, for syntax highlighting. It is recommended to use backticks for code blocks in Markdown content. For example:

item.title: LaTeX
item.description: $\KaTeX$ is used for rendering LaTeX math expressions. It can be enabled per page by setting math to true in the page front matter.

item.title: Deploy Site
item.description: Hugo generates static websites, allowing for flexible hosting options. This page provides guides for deploying your Hextra site on various platforms.
